item.title: One minute hacks: Saving time inserting images in Libreoffice
Extracting movies from libreoffice
item.description: I have a short movie that I imported into a libreoffice presentation. I wanted a copy of that movie back, but I couldn’t figure out how to extract a copy. In desperation, I figured I’d try opening the file with file-roller, the GNOME archive manager. james@computer:/tmp$ file mgmt-berlin-osdc-17may2017.odp mgmt-berlin-osdc-17may2017.odp: OpenDocument Presentation james@computer:/tmp$ mkdir out james@computer:/tmp$ file-roller -f mgmt-berlin-osdc-17may2017.odp -e out/ [snip] james@computer:/tmp$ cd out/ james@computer:/tmp/out$ ls Configurations2/ Media/ meta.xml Pictures/ styles.
